content: Even as admin, I cannot add subscribers to private streams I'm not myself subscribed to. I can remove everyone, but cannot add anyone. IMO this is inconsistent behaviour, especially for admin accounts, which should have full control over every stream or none at all.

This is consistent behavior, with the rule "Administrators cannot access private message or private stream content unless an existing subscriber adds them".

We are considering adding a feature to allow "Organization owners", a new concept in 3.0, to change the rules for how private streams work; since there's definitely organizations for whom that preference doesn't make sense.

Okay, thank you for explaining the reasoning behind this decision, I get it now. Nevertheless, it does not really make sense to give admins the permission to remove subscribers from streams they're [the admins] not subscribed to.

it does not really make sense to give admins the permission to remove subscribers from streams they're [the admins] not subscribed to.

Agreed, I don't think we should allow that under the current model, though it doesn't seem super harmful
The plan here, for context, is to add a "Stream admin" role that can help fill in the gaps here; that will definitely be in 4.0.
(There's an open PR we'll be starting to integrate any day now)

Hi,

just to follow up: we're running Zulip 5.5 and there is no role "stream admin" yet. Is this supposed to be a global role like "Moderator" or "Administrator"? IMO the most logical way would be to implement this on a per-stream basis, so no one is a Stream Admin for more then their own streams. But as of version 5.5 creators of streams cannot unsubscribe people from their own streams unfortunately...

@Christoph we ended up moving away from the original stream administrator plan (which was going to be per-stream) in favor of using user groups. You can follow the work here: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/19525
@Tim Abbott thank you, I did not realise this idea had been overhauled in the meantime.
